result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Marie Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bond shall be applied towards the costs.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant's bond shall be applied towards the fine and costs.

The jail sentence is time served.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with the Driver Safety Plan.

records.addlTxt: Ignition Interlock Device Court Order

Defendant Ashley Marie Meyer in court with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abernethy-Mays indicated that she has gone over the presentence report with the defendant.  Attorney Tlusty recites her recommendation for sentencing.  Attorney Abernethy-Mays recites her recommendation for sentencing.  Court orders on Count 1 - withheld sentence placement on probation for five year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Count 5 - withheld sentence placement on probation for 2 years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation. 81 days sentence credit.  Count 7 - straight sentence of $2,010.00 fine; 90 days county with huber and good time with 90 days sentence credit; 26 month driver's license revocation with credit for any administrative suspension; IID; $45.00 blood draw; AODA and compliance with driver safety plan.  - rt

Defendant Ashley Marie Meyer in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to counts 1, 5 and 7.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 5 and 7.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts.  Court would like a presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 01:00 pm. - rt

Defendant Ashley Marie Meyer in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays by phone.  Defendant Ashley Marie Meyer in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant regarding waiving preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing. This matter to be scheduled for a pretrial conference.  Attorney Abernethy-Mays is requesting a bond modification.  Argument by Attorneys.  Court denies request to modify bond.  - rt

Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ashley M. Meyer appeared. Shawn M. Paul appeared for Ashley M. Meyer. Ms. Meyer wrote a letter requesting modification of bond. Atty. Tlusty objects to modification of bond. Atty. Paul requests a high signature bond. Court orders a reduced cash bond of $2,500.00 with same conditions as the previous bond. ef

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Initial Appearance on December 29, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

ADR began at 3:32 pm  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Ashley M. Meyer appears in person, in custody.   Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $6,000.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is December 29, 2015 at 1:00 pm.  ADR ended at 3:29 pm - rt
